meanings.definition: The practice or condition of having only one wife at a time.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, monogyny is the norm, with a man having only one wife.
meanings.sent2: Monogyny is when a person is committed to one spouse throughout their life.
meanings.sent3: John joked that his monogyny made him an expert in remembering anniversaries.
meanings.sent4: The concept of monogyny can be compared to a solitary tree standing tall amidst a vast forest.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of monogyny ensures a deep and lasting connection between partners.

meanings.sent1: Monogyny reflects a strong bond between partners who choose to be exclusive.
meanings.sent2: The monogyny of the couple was evident in their unwavering commitment to each other.
meanings.sent3: The monogyny of the penguins in the documentary was both heartwarming and fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The monogyny of the swans symbolized loyalty and devotion in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The purity of their monogyny shone brightly in a world of fleeting relationships.

meanings.definition: The custom of marrying only once in a lifetime.
meanings.sent1: For some, monogyny means finding a lifelong partner and sticking with them.
meanings.sent2: Monogyny is a tradition that values commitment and fidelity above all.
meanings.sent3: The village celebrated the couple's monogyny with a grand feast and dance.
meanings.sent4: In a world of multiple marriages, their monogyny was a rare and precious gem.
meanings.sent5: The concept of monogyny echoes through generations, honoring the bond of marriage.
